Legal_Issue: Relevance and protection of sensitive information in discovery
Evidence_Assessment: Assessment of relevance and necessity of disclosed information
Burden_of_Proof: On parties challenging discovery orders to show irrelevance or undue intrusion
Legal_Rule: Federal Court Rule 336(5) allows appeals; discretionary orders reviewed if 'clearly wrong' or 'vital to the final issue'
Standard_of_Review: Clearly wrong or vital to the final issue
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged patent infringement related to lottery ticket integrity number
Outcome_on_Merits: Orders modified to balance discovery rights and protection of competitive data
Judicial_Review_Outcome: Partial success for both parties on appeal
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Balancing right to discovery with protection against unnecessary intrusion
Key_Evidence_Considered: Competitive data, relevance of discovery requests
Legal_Framework: Canadian Federal Court Rules, patent law
Applicant_Challenge: Challenges to scope and relevance of discovery
Defendant_Response: Argued against relevance and sought protection of sensitive business information
Remedy_Requested: Restriction of discovery to prevent disclosure of sensitive information
Outcome: Partial allowance of appeals; some discovery permitted with safeguards
Legal_Provision: Rule 336(5) of the Federal Court Rules
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Information not relevant or overly intrusive
Applicable_Process: Appeal process under Federal Court Rules
Outcome_of_Review: Discovery orders adjusted to protect sensitive data while allowing relevant discovery
